speaker: Robert
text: Now for a difficult one.

speaker: Niles
text: [_tastes_] Firm, velvety rind, a bit smokey, mmm... applewood, I think.

speaker: Robert
text: Oui.

speaker: Martin
text: This is what I get for sending you to sleep-away camp in France!

speaker: Robert
text: Can I help you with anything else, monsieur?

speaker: Martin
text: No thanks, this six-dollar can of dog food will be fine.  It sure teaches me not to leave my shopping till the last minute again.

speaker: Niles
text: [_realizes_] Oh, is it Reblochon?

speaker: Robert
text: You are good, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, he's a regular cheese whiz!

speaker: Niles
text: I'll take half a pound of the Reblochon and half a pound of St. Andre and I know I ask this every week but... is it here?

speaker: Robert
text: Is what here?

speaker: Niles
text: You know very well what I mean; the imported Swiss prosciutto.

speaker: Robert
text: Aaah, the Bidnelfleisch!  I am sorry, if only you had been here one hour ago...

speaker: Niles
text: Damn!

speaker: Robert
text: You would have seen it arrive.  _He bursts into mocking, high-pitched laughter.  Niles laughs a little too - while breathing heavily and clutching his heart._

speaker: Robert
text: I have my fun with you.

speaker: Niles
text: [_tormented_] You do, Robert, you make me long for the days when you barely spoke English.  Slice, slice like the wind, I'll take a pound.

speaker: Martin
text: Whoa!  Eighteen dollars a pound!  This salami's good, but it's not that good.

speaker: Robert
text: That _saucissons_ was aged for six months and was cured in a small village at the foot of the Pyrenees at Gilder Brown. It's a steal at that price.

speaker: Martin
text: You got that right, pal.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, if you want to wait outside, I'll be through in a minute.

speaker: Martin
text: What?  I'm fine.  Whoa-ho, look at all these different kinds of olive oil.  Virgin, extra-virgin. [_laughs_] Extra-virgin? How does that work? [_laughs_] Well, I guess if you can cure a sausage!

speaker: Robert
text: Monsieur, I'm so glad you find my foods so amusing.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, Robert, he's only joking, keep on slicing.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, come on now, even you've got to admit this whole store's kinda nutty.

speaker: Robert
text: Pardon?

speaker: Martin
text: Fourteen dollars for a pound of goat's cheese.  God, at that price I ought to be able to get a whole goat!

speaker: Niles
text: We're slicing.

speaker: Robert
text: [_to Martin_] Perhaps, Monsieur, you would be more comfortable if you just waited outside.

speaker: Martin
text: You want me to leave, just come out and say it in plain English.

speaker: Robert
text: Fine, leave from my store.

speaker: Martin
text: Okay, no problem.  Come on Niles, you heard the man, he wants us to [_French accent_] "leave from his store."

speaker: Robert
text: Don't hurry back.

speaker: Martin
text: Don't worry, all the money in the world wouldn't get me back in this snob shop.

speaker: Niles
text: That man is my father, so obviously I cannot leave here with a bag full of your merchandise.

speaker: Robert
text: Home delivery?

speaker: Niles
text: [_quietly_] Thank you. [_shouts_] No-one treats my father that way... [_quietly_] Those olives, too. [_shouts_] No-one!  _As he exits, Robert nods and puts the olives aside.  FADE OUT_  **OUT & IN**  _Scene Two - Radio Station Frasier is walking the corridors of KACL outside his booth as a young woman, Sharon, from the station, comes over to him._

speaker: Sharon
text: About the photo shoot tomorrow, will you be needing make-up?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, heavens, no!

speaker: Sharon
text: That's a good choice, because I think that you look very handsome without it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  Well, I think you look very attractive with make-up. Not that I'm saying you need make-up, it's that if indeed you are wearing make-up, it's so expertly applied that I wouldn't even know you're wearing make-up... [_sighs_] I'm sure it looks like I'm wearing some rouge right now.

speaker: Sharon
text: I know what you meant, and thank you.  Oh, Dr. Crane, I was meaning to ask you: what do you think about two people who work together dating?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, Sharon, I'm asked that question a lot and let me tell you, the stark reality is that that situation is fraught with...

speaker: Frasier
text: ...[_smiles_] delightful possibilities.

speaker: Sharon
text: So, are you free on Friday?

speaker: Frasier
text: Er, Friday, yes, Friday it is.  After the show?

speaker: Sharon
text: Great.

speaker: Frasier
text: Great.

speaker: Sharon
text: Okay.

speaker: Frasier
text: Bye.  _Frasier enters his booth with a smile on his face.  In the booth, he meets a handsome young man by the name of Dr. Clint Webber._

speaker: Clint
text: Dr. Crane?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Clint
text: Clint Webber.  The station just hired me to host the new show on health issues.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes, of course, Dr. Webber.  Well, welcome to KACL.

speaker: Clint
text: I understand I'm in your debt for recommending my audition tape.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, not at all, it was very good, very good indeed.  Besides, you know, we'd all gotten a bit tired of the last show that was in that timeslot; "Bert The Backyard Gardener."  A woman in her latest crock gave new meaning to the term, "Potting Shed"! [_Roz enters_] Ah, perfect timing, come Clint.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz Doyle, my producer, this is Dr. Clint Webber, the new host of "Health Watch."

speaker: Roz
text: [_taken aback_] Hi.

speaker: Clint
text: Hi, great to meet you.

speaker: Roz
text: [_flirting_] So, er, you're new?

speaker: Clint
text: That's right.

speaker: Roz
text: And a doctor?

speaker: Clint
text: That's right.

speaker: Clint
text: Well, I don't want to be late for that station tour. [_exits_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, again, welcome aboard, Clint.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, my God, could I acted any goofier?

speaker: Frasier
text: Not without a set of fake buck-teeth!

speaker: Roz
text: He's so handsome, I can't work with someone that handsome. [_realizes_] No offense.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, none taken.  Granted, when it comes to the looks department, Dr. Webber and I aren't in the same...

speaker: Roz
text: [_jumps in_] Species?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I was going to say "league," but species is so much more insulting!

speaker: Bulldog
text: This stinks, this is total BS!  The chicks are all going nuts over this new Webber guy.  I'm supposed to be the only sex symbol around here. [_pulls shirt up showing his torso_] Wait, look at it, look at it.  Come on, take your best shot.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Whoa-ho, not you! [_indicating Frasier and Gil_] One of those guys.

speaker: Frasier
text: Bulldog, you're behaving immaturely even for you.  Granted the man's handsome but it's no reason to feel threatened.

speaker: Gil
text: I must confess, I didn't notice he was all that handsome.

speaker: Roz
text: You didn't notice? [_laughs_] You of all people?

speaker: Gil
text: Just what are you insinuating?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, you know, you're a little... er....

speaker: Gil
text: For your information, I happen to be a happily married man.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're... married?

speaker: Bulldog
text: To a woman?

speaker: Gil
text: Of course to a woman!  You've all heard me mention Deb. Well, how often have I said, "I must be running along now, Deb will be waiting."

speaker: Roz
text: We thought Deb was your cat.

speaker: Gil
text: She is not a cat!  She is Mrs. Gilbert Leslie Chesterton, a Sarah Lawrence graduate, and the owner of a very successful auto body repair shop.  Honestly, the conclusions people make, just because a man dresses well and knows how to use a pastry bag!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's the first time I've ever seen a man "in" himself. _FADE TO:  Scene Three - Caf e Nervosa We see a very depressed Eddie lying on the floor of the Cafe.  The scene pulls up to show Niles and Martin sitting at the table beside him._

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, I can't help noticing Eddie's looking a bit glum.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, he's mad at me.  I gave him a can of that dog food from your fancy gourmet place the other day.

speaker: Niles
text: He didn't like it?

speaker: Martin
text: No, he loved it, but now he won't eat anything else!  He even turned his nose up at a kosher pickle and he loves those.  And the bad thing is, I called all over Seattle and Frenchie's the only one who carries that stuff.

speaker: Niles
text: I don't suppose you'd consider apologizing?

speaker: Martin
text: Forget it, I'm never setting foot in that store again.

speaker: Niles
text: If things get worse, there is a technique of sleep-feeding I know.  It involves an eye-dropper and a high fructose protein shake.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I don't know about that.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, it worked on Maris.

speaker: Niles
text: [_indicating a rash on Frasier's cheek_] Frasier, are you aware?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I'm aware.  We were taking publicity photos today, I had an allergic reaction to the make-up I was wearing.  I wasn't planning on wearing any make-up at all but there's this handsome new employee at the station, everybody's feeling incredibly insecure about their looks.  They were all slapping their make-up on, so I too gave in to vanity. [_Clint enters and goes to the counter_] And, like Icarus flying too close to the sun I had to pay the price.

speaker: Martin
text: [_noticing Clint_] Wow!

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Dad, I don't like to go with mythology too often, but that was spot-on...

speaker: Martin
text: No, I mean that guy, he's so handsome.

speaker: Roz
text: It's him, it's him, Dr. Webber.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, Roz!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, he is striking.

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier's just jealous.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I am not jealous.  Yes, the man is handsome, but I'm sure there are a number of areas in which I am his superior.  You know, let's not forget that good looks can be a mixed blessing.  People just roll out the red carpet for you but that robs you of any incentive to develop other qualities. After a while you're left an aging narcissist bent at the water's edge, realizing those lines in the pond aren't ripples, they're wrinkles.

speaker: Martin
text: Amazing.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, dad, I rather like that one myself.

speaker: Martin
text: That guy could be a movie star!

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, Roz, don't we have some work... [_notices free table_] over there?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, no, no, take this table, I have a session anyway.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, I gotta go too.  Like Zeus riding his thunderbolt to Mount...

speaker: Frasier
text: Very amusing Dad, off you go. _Martin takes Eddie and leaves with Niles as Clint comes over to the table._

speaker: Clint
text: Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Dr. Webber.  You remember Roz Doyle, of course.

speaker: Clint
text: Yes, hello.

speaker: Frasier
text: Who could forget that infectious laugh?

speaker: Clint
text: Speaking of which, has anyone had a look at that rash?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes, everybody.

speaker: Clint
text: So, mind if I join you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually we were...

speaker: Roz
text: We were hoping you would. _Roz saucily pushes out a chair with her foot for him to sit at, he sits._

speaker: Frasier
text: So, Clint, I see that you're a squash player.  You know, if you're up for a game some day, I used to play a bit back in Harvard.

speaker: Clint
text: Well, I'd love to.  Harvard?  Wow!  I was dying to go to Harvard.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm sure the school you went to was just as good.

speaker: Clint
text: I went to Oxford.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, even better.  So, did you go to medical school there as well?

speaker: Clint
text: Yes, but I took a year off first to get my Master's in French history.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah?

speaker: Clint
text: Just wanted to do something fun.

speaker: Frasier
text: Mmmm.

speaker: Roz
text: Does that mean you speak French?

speaker: Clint
text: _Certainement, pois je conte belle fais._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I too understand the importance in taking some time off before beginning medical school.  I spent that summer in Milan studying the history of opera.  In fact, I had the good fortune to make an acquaintance and become friends with a then-little-known young tenor by the name of Carreras.

speaker: Clint
text: Jose Carreras?

speaker: Frasier
text: Forgive the name dropping.

speaker: Clint
text: He's my godfather.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_very jealous_] You're joking!

speaker: Clint
text: No, I'll call him tonight, he'll be delighted to hear I'm working with you.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_laughs_] I'll be interested to see if he remembers the game we used to play where we pretended not to remember one another.

speaker: Clint
text: You know, Frasier, that rash is starting to concern me. Maybe I'll just pop out to the car and get my medical gear.

speaker: Frasier
text: There's really no need.

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay, maybe we can work now while he's gone. [_Roz starts fanning herself_] Oh, Roz, for heaven's sake.  You're behaving like a starry eyed Bobby Socks-er.  Yes, the man is good looking, it's not like he can stop traffic!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_off Roz's look_] There's a blind corner out there, we don't know that was him!  _End of Act One  Act Two  Scene One - Radio Station Clint and Frasier arrive in the booth to meet Roz who is on one of her pregnancy cravings it seems._

speaker: Roz
text: How was your squash game?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, Dr. Webber neglected to mention that he was squash champion back in college.

speaker: Roz
text: I'm sorry, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no, not at all.  It was a lovely morning, Clint was gracious enough to treat me to breakfast.  Course, once we arrived at "Le Renee," the chef had just cut himself.  Clint not only treated the wound but set about to making us a flawless egg-white and truffle omelet.

speaker: Clint
text: I put myself through med school as a sous-chef at "Le Cirque."

speaker: Roz
text: Sometimes I just want to pinch you to make sure you're real.

speaker: Frasier
text: He's real. [_sits_]

speaker: Clint
text: I'm just going to get a glass of water, I'll be right back. [_exits_]

speaker: Roz
text: But you're about to start the show.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I know, Roz, I thought it would be a good idea to have Clint on, introduce him to my listeners, give his show a leg up.

speaker: Roz
text: All right, you're plugging Clint?!  I'm sorry, I'm having a lot of trouble believing this buddy-buddy attitude.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, try as you may to insinuate that I have some seething jealousy to this man, the fact is, I like Clint.  Why else would I be giving a party in his honour this evening?

speaker: Roz
text: Okay.  You're on in ten seconds.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, right up.  Let's just slip on our headphones, and follow my lead, okay? [_presses button_] Good afternoon, Seattle, this is Dr. Frasier Crane.  Before we start our regular program, I'd like to take this opportunity to introduce you to Dr. Clint Webber.  Clint, if you're anything like I am, you'll spend your first week trying to figure out what all these buttons do.

speaker: Clint
text: Actually, in college I ran the radio station.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, well, things may have gotten a bit more sophisticated since then.  For instance we have here a cough button. [_presses and releases the button_]

speaker: Clint
text: If I'm not mistaken that's the echo button.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_laughs_] Of course it is.  All my listeners are familiar with my now-trademark "echoing cough"! [_laughs_] Well, let's go to the lines, take our first call, show Dr. Webber the ropes, shall we? [_presses button_] Go ahead, you're on the air.

speaker: Marie
text: [_v.o_] Oh, hi, hi, Dr. Crane, it's Marie.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hello, Marie, I'm listening.

speaker: Marie
text: [_v.o_] I, I've been having a hard time getting out of bed every morning and when I finally do I'm irritable for hours.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  Well, Marie, the desire to stay in bed is very similar to the desire to regress to the womb.  Some unconscious fear is driving you to a place of safety. Now, in order to resolve this problem you're going to have to examine your life and discover just what it is you're retreating from.  It's hard but very necessary work, I suggest that it maybe time to try some therapy.

speaker: Marie
text: [_v.o_] Wow!

speaker: Clint
text: You are good, Dr. Crane.  The first thing that came to my head was that she might be a little hypoglycemic, I'd have suggested some protein in the morning.

speaker: Marie
text: [_v.o_] Oh, wait a minute.  Last Thursday I had eggs for breakfast and I felt great all day.

speaker: Clint
text: Well, maybe that's it, then.

speaker: Marie
text: [_v.o_] Oh, what a relief!  You know, you scared the life out of me, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, thank you, Marie. [_presses button_] But I think it's time to say goodbye to Dr. Webber now and we'll be back right after these messages. [_signs off_]

speaker: Clint
text: Thanks, Frasier, that was fun.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, it was, wasn't it?

speaker: Clint
text: I hope I didn't say anything out of line.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no, no, not at all, I always enjoy learning something new.  Well, I'll see you tonight, don't be late.

speaker: Clint
text: I'm always punctual.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_covers anger with a laugh_] Of course you are!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_lightly_] I hate him. **BONE APP�TIT**  _Scene Two -- High-Priced French Gourmet Shop Daphne and Martin enter and notice Robert is not there, only his assistant. _

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, he's not even here.

speaker: Daphne
text: Your luck's out.

speaker: Martin
text: [_goes to assistant_] Yes, I'll just take a case of that dog food, please.

speaker: Assistant
text: Will that be all?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, that's it and I'm in a bit of a hurry.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_picks up biscuits laughing_] Look here, Nickerson's Lemon Biscuits.  God, these bring back memories.  I just love them.  Do you carry the Raspberry ones as well?

speaker: Assistant
text: I'm not sure.

speaker: Martin
text: Could you come back for those?

speaker: Assistant
text: [_calls back_] Robert?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, God.

speaker: Robert
text: Well, look who's come back.

speaker: Martin
text: Look, why don't you just let me pay for this and get out of here?  What do I owe you?

speaker: Robert
text: I think we both know what you owe me.

speaker: Martin
text: All right.  I'm sorry, I shouldn't have made fun of your store.  You gonna let me off the hook or not?

speaker: Robert
text: All right, I'll sell it to you.  I never like to lose a customer.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, great.  You know, while I'm here I might as well take a few cases.

speaker: Robert
text: We have several new varieties in if you'd care to take a look.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, sure.

speaker: Robert
text: Please, show the man.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_looks at her biscuits_] Oh, I think these biscuits are mis-marked.

speaker: Robert
text: [_looks_] No, that's correct.

speaker: Daphne
text: $14.95 for a package this small?!

speaker: Robert
text: I see we have another member of the price club!

speaker: Daphne
text: Hey, there's no need for that attitude.  Back home I can get these for 80 pence!

speaker: Robert
text: Well, I do have to fly these over.

speaker: Daphne
text: What did you do?  Buy them a seat on the Concorde?!

speaker: Robert
text: Madame, if you cannot afford them, simply put them back.

speaker: Daphne
text: I can bloody well afford them, I just don't like being gouged, this is robbery!

speaker: Robert
text: Robber! [_he pronounces it "Ro-bear"_] No-one calls me a robber!

speaker: Assistant
text: [_o.s_] Robert?

speaker: Robert
text: Not now! [_to Daphne_] On your way out you will see a sign on the door saying "Please come again."  Disregard it!

speaker: Daphne
text: I'd be happy to.  You know, Mr. Crane was right about you. You're nothing but an arrogant, swindling little cheese- monger.

speaker: Martin
text: [_enters with dog food_] This is great!  I'll take a case of each.

speaker: Robert
text: [_snatches it away_] You'll take a case of nothing!

speaker: Martin
text: What happened now?

speaker: Daphne
text: We don't need him or his food!

speaker: Martin
text: Yes, we do, he's got tarragon flavor now!

speaker: Daphne
text: Come on!

speaker: Martin
text: But Daph, what about Eddie?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, he'll eat when he gets hungry.  For heaven's sakes, he drinks out of the toilet!  _Daphne pulls Martin out of the shop.  FADE TO:  Scene Three - Frasier's Apartment. A huge crowd is gathered for the party as Clint tells them all a story._

speaker: Clint
text: So, George S. Kaufmann so dislikes what the actor is doing, he sends the poor fellow a telegram reading, "I'm watching your performance from the rear of the house, wish you were here." [_they all laugh_] Sorry to jump in there, Frasier, but I believe that's the story you started.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thanks for helping out.

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_comes up to Frasier_] Hey, Doc, I gotta hand it to you, great way to welcome the new guy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, really?  I'm surprised you're even here at the party.  I didn't think you cared much for Clint.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Nah, I'm over that.  I figured, he can't have every chick. So if we pal around, I bag the leftovers.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, the regular busboy romance.  Excuse me. [_opens door to Niles_] Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: How's it going?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, let me see, what have you missed?  Clint told us about how he learned to fly a plane, and then he recited a sonnet and, oh yes, he fixed my ice machine and he invented a new drink; the "Pink Webber"!  He's got Daphne drawing a bath right now, in case the party starts to lag, he invited to walk on water, liven things up a bit.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, don't let it make you crazy, Frasier.  At some point we all run into someone who's our superior.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's just that I've never dealt with this sort of thing before.

speaker: Niles
text: Never?!

speaker: Frasier
text: I can see how that might be baffling to you, as my younger brother, you dealt with this thing all your life.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, well, at least we know he won't out shine you in the egomania department! [_takes a "Pink Webber"_]

speaker: Frasier
text: You're right, I'm being a bit silly about this thing, I suppose.  I just wish I could one flaw, one area where I'm his superior.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I'm sure you will.... [_takes a sip_] Although it won't be in the drink department, this is heaven in a glass!  _Frasier walks off to Clint who is mulling over a chess game that is set out on the side._

speaker: Clint
text: Oh, Frasier, I was just admiring this chess board, it's beautiful.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.  Do you play?

speaker: Clint
text: No, I've read a book or two.  Are you in the middle of a match?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, yes, as a matter of fact, I'm playing by mail with a Russian grand master.  It's quite challenging.

speaker: Clint
text: Well, congratulations.  With your cunning use of the Zekreptsky attack, you're only four moves away from certain victory!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_looks_] My God, you're right.  And actually I'd be happy to hear that, except I'm playing black, well... wasn't that a fun eight months!

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Sharon.  Sorry we haven't had a chance to speak much.

speaker: Sharon
text: Oh, I know but I'm really looking forward to our date on Friday.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, so am I, and you look absolutely beautiful - or should I say...

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Boy, what's so funny?

speaker: Sharon
text: Well, you just told me "I was as a lovely as a chicken beak."

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, really? [_he repeats the Mandarin and Clint overhears_]

speaker: Clint
text: Who's as lovely as a chicken beak?

speaker: Sharon
text: You speak Mandarin?  _Clint and Sharon begin having a conversation in Mandarin.  Frasier leaves them to it in despair to the kitchen.  Soon, Clint follows as the pianist strikes up "Isn't It Romantic."_

speaker: Clint
text: Frasier, I just wanted to thank you for this party.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, don't mention it.

speaker: Clint
text: It's been a perfect evening; The hors d'oeuvres, the company, the music.  Oh, I love this song.

speaker: Frasier
text: Enjoy.  _Frasier leaves the kitchen and overhears Clint singing along to "Isn't It Romantic" in a voice that would cause plastic to wish it could shatter._

speaker: Clint
text: "Isn't it romantic? Music in the night...

speaker: Clint
text: Oh, I'm sorry, I was singing too loud.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, not at all.  I can't tell you how much I'm enjoying hearing it.

speaker: Clint
text: Careful, it doesn't take much coaxing to get me to perform.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?

speaker: Clint
text: Oh, yes, get a glass of wine in me, before you know it, I'm serenading the entire room.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?

speaker: Clint
text: Oh, I'm afraid I have a bit of the old ham in me. [_laughs_] Would it be presumptuous to sing in front of your guests?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I think we could persuade the piano player to play it again. _Frasier and Clint enter the main area.  Frasier goes over to Niles as Clint makes his way to the piano._

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, Niles, I've done it.  I have found his Achilles Heel!

speaker: Niles
text: Ah, who's?

speaker: Frasier
text: Clint's!  Oh, I just heard him singing, the man is completely tone deaf.  He's about to launch into a rendition of "Isn't It Romantic" that will simply peel the enamel from your teeth!

speaker: Niles
text: Are you sure you want to let him do that?

speaker: Frasier
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, you have your victory, you're a wonderful singer. Isn't it enough to know that?  Do you really need to see him humiliate himself?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Niles
text: Now, Frasier...

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, no, I know, you're right.  I guess I am a bigger man than that.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hey, Dr. Crane, your friend, Clint, he's quite a charmer.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, he is, isn't he?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, do you suppose he's single? [_this alerts Niles_] I was just getting up the nerve to give him my phone number.

speaker: Clint
text: Excuse me, everyone.  I just want to thank you all for this warm welcome to KACL and as a token of my gratitude, I'd like to share this song with you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Clint, there's been a little change of plan...

speaker: Niles
text: Yes!  I'm going to be your accompanist now!  _Niles quickly runs over and takes his seat at the piano.  He starts to play as Clint sings in the same awful voice._

speaker: Clint
text: "Isn't it romantic? Music in the night, A dream that can't be heard...  Isn't it romantic?....... _Niles gleefully continues playing.  Frasier walks past a gobsmacked Daphne.  Among the disappointed and embarrassed guests, he suddenly plays the voice of reason:_

speaker: Frasier
text: Please, everybody... nobody's perfect.
